reviews.review_msg: Even though sometimes grading criteria was unclear, if you come to class, pay attention and participate you will do well. You do not not get much feedback throughout but she is more than happy to meet with you to discuss the assignments. Approachable and caring professor that makes you find joy in learning rather than being hardcore about grades

Participation *really* matters in this class! A lot of class discussions, small group discussions.. a lot of group activities (which were fun because they were very interactive). A lot of writing, but mainly for your own learning and what your views are in multicultural theories & counseling. No grading throughout, but that wasn't a problem for me.

Nothing was marked. There's no way of knowing how grades were assigned. Sharalyn was unreachable by email, and did not offer office hours. The Canvas page was nearly impossible to navigate. Classwork was great (discussions and exercises were engaging). This would be an excellent course if she had a TA to mark assignments and answer emails.

Did not receive a single grade all term. No feedback on any assignments. When you asked for feedback, all you got was "You are doing great, don't worry!" They are very kind, but it doesn't mean anything when you have no idea how you are doing in the course.

Although kind + supportive, Sharalyn was incredibly disorganized. Canvas was a mess with many dead links and random files. No clear guidelines on assignment requirements and grading criteria. No grades were given throughout the entire semester so academic standing was 100% unknown. Discussions were great but overall it was unnecessarily stressful.

The whole class is not very organized.  The Canvas shell is hard to navigate and updated randomly.  Textbook is very hard to read.  Class lectures are ok.  Her quizzes are very hard and all based on theory.  Overall I didnt enjoy this class.

Terribly disorganized. Canvas was a joke: mostly outdated files. I could never do the readings before class because I didn't know what to read. Does not respond to emails. Kind person, but lack of organization and lack of clarity of expectations made this an incredibly stressful class. Such a disappointment: I was looking forward to this class.

Although very kind, Sharalyn was not the ideal professor, especially for online learning. Not accessible at ALL outside of class, very slow on grading, Canvas page/syllabus very unorganized creating a high anxiety class experience. This class was a huge disappointment and I wish I had a different professor, or that Sharalyn had a TA to help.

Nice in class, but she doesn't grade fast. Most people have 5/9 grades posted. She doesn't reply to emails or phone calls, not even when she prompts us to. She only gives full marks on papers if she "forgets that she's reading a student paper." She doesn't get you feedback for your group papers because she can't set up group on Canvas properly.

Sharalyn is very kind but does not answer her emails, does not provide clear grading criteria, does not release grades on canvas, and her quizzes and lectures are confusing and scattered. Very disorganized and clearly she needs a TA and a separate email to cope with the work. Dont recommend online as when you cant email her its so hard to complete

Sharalyn is super nice and approachable but that can only get you so far in a learning environment. We didn't get feedback on any assignments, had almost no grading criteria and she ignored our e-mails. I hope in the future she can get a TA to help with this stuff because if she organized better the class would've been so much more enjoyable!

Sharalyn is an awful communicator. I had her for a required upper-division course and nobody in my class was ever able to contact her after class time. She is terribly disorganized and not well versed in technology. Her Canvas page was terribly disorganized. She was not quick at marking and giving feedback. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE

Group project worth 70% of grade. Out of the 6 submitted assignments, only received a grade for 1 of them (worth 5 points) all semester, hence final grade was assigned with practically 0 indication as to why. Organized during class, but MIA/unprofessional outside class. however, very kind personality/teaching style, engaging lecture.

Great professor. Intellectually challenging course without it being overkill. She has a calm and caring demeanor that puts students at ease. Good at meeting students where they are at and kindly pushing them forward to become better counsellors.

Sharalyn is passionate about her research and very informative. However, she doesn't care about her students.  She told us to study the wrong chapter for a quiz and didn't even apologize. She also doesn't post grades on Canvas, so it's hard to have an idea about your performance in this class. 1 word: MESS, but it's an engaging class.

interesting topics but frustrating prof. disorganized course planning, unclear expectations & grading criteria, hands back work late, don't reply to emails when you need her to, 2 big papers worth 50% all due at end of the semester, confusing on canvas, too much work. willing to help & a great reflective listener but i regretted taking this class.

such a sweetheart! choice of midterm paper or group presentation- do the presentation if you can, better chance of higher marks! quizzes are easy & straight from the text, they count for attendance too. final is all written but easy. she is perfect!!!!! really engages with her students & encourages discussion, but it's natural & fun!

Amazing professor. Very kind, approachable, understanding and accommodating to students. Lectures are always interesting. Assignments and exams not hard if you keep up with readings and attend lecture. Weekly quizzes, very easy if you just do the reading. Overall, amazing and would highly recommend her!!! Take this class with her :)
